commits.subject: fix(core): resolve 8 runtime and quality issues from code review
commits.body:
- Fix station detail coordinate extraction: parse PostGIS GeoJSON
  instead of accessing non-existent .latitude/.longitude properties
  (was sending users to 0,0 for directions)
- Fix fuel type names: query fuel_prices table (has FK for PostgREST
  join) instead of current_prices materialized view (no FK, join
  silently fails, shows "Unknown" for all fuel types)
- Fix Mapbox token init: FuelMap and StationMarker now import from
  lib/mapbox init module instead of @rnmapbox/maps directly, ensuring
  setAccessToken is called before map renders
- Fix map/list toggle: make views mutually exclusive (list was always
  visible regardless of toggle state)
- Add admin auth warning banner: persistent banner in admin layout
  warns that edits may fail without a valid admin session
- Add updated_at trigger: new migration auto-sets stations.updated_at
  on row update, removing fragile client-side timestamp setting
- Remove dead dark mode branching: root layout hardcodes DefaultTheme
  since all components use light-only styles
- Fix inconsistent imports: standardize to relative paths (was mixing
  @/ alias with ../../ relative paths)

Tags: bugfix, code-review, database, mapbox, admin, ux
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 4
Impact: user-facing
Risk: medium
Debt: paid
Epic: code-review
Semver: patch

commits.subject: feat(admin): build station management interface (Deliverable 6)
commits.body:
Admin station list with search, active/inactive status badges,
and activate/deactivate toggle with confirmation dialog.

Admin station edit form with validation (name, address, city required),
brand, postal code, phone, active toggle, and save with error feedback.

PriceEditor component: inline per-fuel-type price editing with upsert
to fuel_prices table. Tap any price to edit, save/cancel per row.

Admin accessible via gear icon in home screen header. Dark-themed
header distinguishes admin from user-facing screens.

Auth deferred — RLS policies enforce admin-only writes at the database
level. Login UI will be added when Supabase Auth is configured.

Tags: admin, station-management, prices, forms, rls
Complexity: 4
Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: added
Epic: admin-interface
Semver: minor

https://claude.ai/code/session_01ThLMrSNuDBKbW88RcsQYpk
commits.title: build station management interface (Deliverable 6)

commits.subject: feat(ui): build home screen, station detail, and core components (Deliverables 3-4)
commits.body:
Implement the full user-facing app shell with search, map, list, and detail views.

Home screen: location detection → fuel type chips → radius chips → map/list
toggle → station cards sorted by distance or cheapest price.

Station detail: full price list with staleness indicators, Get Directions
button (deep link to native maps), phone tap-to-call, amenity chips.

Components: FuelMap, StationMarker, StationCard, StationList, PriceDisplay,
FuelTypeSelector, RadiusSelector.

Hooks: useLocation (GPS + JHB fallback), useStations (RPC + grouping),
useFuelTypes (Supabase query).

Utilities: navigation.ts (platform deep links), formatting.ts (prices,
distances, dates, staleness).

Tags: ui, home-screen, station-detail, map, components, hooks
Complexity: 4
Urgency: 2
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: neutral
Epic: app-shell
Semver: minor

commits.subject: feat(init): scaffold Expo project with Supabase schema and geospatial queries
commits.body:
Project initialization for the fuel station finder app:
- Expo SDK 54 with TypeScript, file-based routing (expo-router), tabs template
- Supabase schema: fuel_types, stations (PostGIS), fuel_prices, price_history
- Materialized view (current_prices) with auto-refresh trigger
- RLS policies: public read for active data, admin full access via JWT role
- find_stations_in_radius() PostgreSQL function for geospatial radius search
- Seed data: 6 SA fuel types, 12 Gauteng stations with sample prices
- Supabase client (src/lib/supabase.ts) and app-level TypeScript types
- Route stubs for station detail and admin views
- .env.example with required env var names

Docker daemon unavailable in this environment so migrations are untested
against a live database — SQL follows the spec exactly and is ready to run
via `supabase start` or against a remote Supabase project.

Tags: expo, supabase, postgis, schema, init
Complexity: 3
Urgency: 2
Impact: infrastructure
Risk: low
Debt: neutral
Epic: fuel-station-finder
Semver: minor
